data.title: Love the smoke!
data.text: When traveling to Dallas always try to include Lockhart at Dallas location. Good smoked barbecue knows no geography. Great meal of Brisket and Chicken and Slaw. Happy belly!

data.title: Lipsmacking Good
data.text: Just plain, old-fashioned delicious. It's all about the meat, and they've got great BBQ meats. Tried the jalapeno cheese sausage and the beef brisket--WOW! Even the Mac 'n Cheese is solid. Glad I don't live near here because if I did, I'd gain 30 pounds!

data.title: Awesome barbecue
data.text: Back in 1970 I lived in San Marcos, Texas and went to the original smokehouse in Lockhart several times. It was great barbecue. Imagine my surprise when we flew in from Seattle and my daughter asked what we would like and I said my wife would like barbecue and we went to this place. Amazing barbecue and still served on butcher paper just like when I went to Lockhart. Friendly staff.

data.title: Good BBQ, but watch your time
data.text: BBQ is quite good, but be watchful of your time to arrive to get your serving.  If you are not in the proper time frame pretty much whatever you want will not be ready until hours later or they just don't have anymore or they didn't prepare that item.  I'm not inclined to stand in line for a "long" time to get a rib or chop and I'm also retired and really don't care to come back at 6PM to yet again stand in line to get what I want.  I guess being retired and trying to eat at such a location just doesn't work for me.  That being said ... the bits of BBQ I did get were very good.

data.title: Meat is off the hook good!
data.text: Ribs and Brisket are so outstanding, great smoke flavor.  Burnt ends are given to you (so freaking great!).  Sides are all hot except for blue cheese cole slaw so no sides for me are exceptable!!  Full bar and good atmosphere.  You will stand in line for the meat but trust me it is worth it.  They have different sauces too for your tastes...  Definite must visit when in the area.

data.title: Heard it was good, it was excellent
data.text:
This is a BBQ place that is the type that goes until they run out of food.. we had that happen to us a free weeks back. So we had to come back and try again today. 
I am glad we did, the brisket was juicy and so tender, the sausage was very flavorful.
Needless to say, we will be going back

data.title: Best BBQ I've ever had. We don't get this in Michigan
data.text: Me and my wife are from Michigan and wanted to try some Texas BBQ on a business trip to the Dallas area. We arrived on a Saturday at 5pm with a sign on the door saying no food until 6pm. Waited at the bar and watched college football and had some good craft beer. They had a few taps and I was happy with that. The bartender was great and very nice to us. We also had fun chatting sports with some LSU fans. We are big UofM fans so it was fun. 6pm came and food was ready. Line became long pretty quick but we were towards the front. I wanted to try everything on the menu lol. Had the best ribs of my life. Wish I got more they were so good. Also had 6 chicken wings, brisket, turkey, and potato salad. All the food was great but the ribs still are on my mind over a week later. Totally recommend Lockhart to anyone visiting the area.

data.title: Good LAWD!
data.text:
Amazing Bbq! Great smokey ribs. Turkey melts in your mouth. Sauce has an after bite of spice. Perfection.

Don't miss it on your TX visit.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text:
Great BBQ restaurant and Bar! A tad pricey.  Good for friends and family. 
Great location in historic downtown Plano.

data.title: Great classic BBQ joint
data.text: Don't miss this place. The smell alone will make your mouth water. The line was there but moved along efficiently. The counter guys were super friendly and helpful. If you want something specific, get there on the early side. By 730pm, they were out of a few things but still had a nice selection. Amazing smoky taste.

data.title: Delicious but SO slow
data.text: Best BBQ I have had in the Dallas area.  The briscuit is melt in your mouth good but was too fatty today.  Having one cutter and one cashier makes the ordering process very inefficient.  They definately could use improvement in that area.  The sides were just ok (mac n cheeae and deviled eggs) but the meat was awesome (we had ribs too).

data.title: Delicious but Slow as Southern Molasses
data.text:
Delicious BBQ and Jalepeno sausage.  Fair- very- average sides are pre-made and served in Styro with plastic knives and forks that had a hard time cutting thru the sausage casing.  BBQ was served on paper! Why not a plate-  is a  dishwasher too costly?  This is not a cheap place.  The line was to the door with a sign outside stating "out of BBQ till 6 pm" on a saturday night 5:45.  There were 3 employees serving and taking the money for the 50 or so waiting in line.  It was moving at a snails pace to be served.  Is that by design?  Again-- How costly is  another server to keep things moving and tables cleaned without the customer needing to do this?  I think this was done for the buzz- the ink- the publicity, you know what I mean.
We Enjoyed the food however and wish the owners excellent results..
We are happy historic downtown Plano has something delicious  like Lockhart Smokehouse.
Sorry  for the honest feedback.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: Great BBQ. Not a big fan of the way it's served in paper but I get over that once I dig into the brisket, pork, ribs, turkey or whatever else they have on the day. Sides are great too. Unfortunately I've never been able to eat in. Downstairs is always crowded and upstairs seems to always be closed. All that being said, I think it's the best BBQ that I've had in this area!

data.title: Authentic Texas BBQ
data.text: We have been hearing great things about the Lockhart Smokehouse in old downtown Plano for about a year...but this was our first visit.  Must say that the food certainly met our expectations...delicious...we had the brisket, clod, ribs, turkey, mac & cheese and jalapeno beans.  On the down side, we did not enjoy the messy way the food was served on butcher paper with plain white bread and plastic dinner wear.  Staff was very slow at clearing tables after the "mess" left behind by departing customers.  Don't expect to much from the service stand point and enjoy the great food!

data.title: Good beers, decent Q
data.text: Had the spare ribs and brisket. The spare ribs were quite good, great flavor but a bit on the tight side. The brisket was average at best. Fairly dry, no smoke ring, and had a tug. I'd go back, but wouldn't go out of my way

data.title: Now that's good Texas BBQ
data.text:
You say you want to tryTexas BBQ?  REAL Texas BBQ?   Well I'd advise skipping the chain places with drive thrus and buffet lines and heading to a place like Lockharts.   This is another of our 'go to' places when were are hungry for BBQ.  Brisket, pork, chicken, sausage -- all smoked right there and done right.  Plenty of choices of sides to go with it too.  And some of the best BBQ sauce around.
The service is always friendly and while you order by the pound/quarter pound/half pound etc -- they always seem to err on the side of giving you a bit more than you paid for.  Good value!
It's not fancy.  But it is clean (I'm a stickler for clean restaurants).  Check it out, I think you'll be back again and again.

data.title: Local smokehouse
data.text: Service was great as line moved quickly. Menu (sides) was  limited. Slaw, potato salad, beans, deviled eggs and Mac Cheese.  Smoked items include Beef, Pork, Chicken, Sausage and Turkey.  Meat is served on butchers paper. Slices of white bread included. No plates.  Sides served in small or large styrofoam containers. Pepsi products. Full bar. Additional seating "upstairs". Meat served by weight (1/2 lb order etc.) You can request just a few slices though. Very casual.

data.title: Excellent Texas BBQ!!
data.text: The brisket and sausage is NOT to be missed! The location is great although the parking can be difficult. Despite the parking, this place is NOT TO BE MISSED if you are looking for real Central Texas BBQ!

data.title: Fantastic brisket - Rustic Dining
data.text: Wow my family loved our BBQ meal here.  We ordered pounds of: brisket, ribs, sausage and roasted chicken.  Our sides included: baked beans, jalapeño Mac-n-cheese and potato salad.  We heaped the proteins in the center of the dinner table and passed the sides.  Yum and so much fun.

data.title: Hidden Treasure
data.text:
In the quaint "downtown" area of Plano, TX, East 15th Street is full of wonderful surprises.  One of them is Lockhart Smokehouse.  My daughter and her husband have been in Plano since 2013, and my husband and I have made several visits.  This was the first time they treated us to that charming area of town.
We walked in just after noon on Sunday, and the place was pretty full (but not as bad as other times when our daughter told us that the line to the counter often extends out the front door).  All the meat is sold by the pound with side dishes and drinks on unit prices.  Service is quick as the butcher slices off meat, approximating the weight of your order and folds it up in brown butcher paper (which serves as a plate, too).
The ribs were full-flavored and very meaty, the brisket was lean and tasty, the turkey had a little extra zip to it, and the sausage had just the right flavor.  The mac-and-cheese is amazing, and the cole slaw has a unique taste.
The four of us, and our 2-year old grandson, ate for $50.15 (based on a scale that the cashier uses to determine your cost) - a GREAT price for the quality and volume.  We had previously eaten at a well-known and highly touted Barbecue place at Legacy (which will go unnamed), but Lockhart was better.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone and plan to return when the opportunity arises.
